Detailed Description

Viwer for a single Gauss integration point. Glyphs for stiffness

double GlyphViewer::HWYglyph ( Matrix  theMatrix,
double  n[3] 
)

Stress or strain tensor. Hashah's method to show shear sigma_S = sqrt{T^2 - sigma^2_N} = sqrt{T_iTi - sigma^2_N} T_i = sigma_{ij}n_j

Returns:
the result of the formula or 0 if not a 2nd order tensor

int GlyphViewer::calcAsymmEigens ( Matrix  theMatrix,
int  leadingDim,
double *  vr,
double *  wr,
double *  wi 
)

calculate eigens for 6 x 6 or 3 x 3. method will allocate eigenvectors real and imaginary parts of eigenvalues. Caller must free.

Parameters:
vr,: right eigenvectors
wr,: real part of eigenvalues
wi,: imaginary part of eigenvalues
Returns:
0 for correct execution

int GlyphViewer::calcSymmEigens ( Matrix  theMatrix,
int  leadingDim,
double *  a,
double *  w 
)

Calculate eignevectors & eigenvalues of symmetric square matrix Caller must allocate eigenvector & eigenvalue arrays

Parameters:
leadingDim,the dimension of the square matrix
w array for eigenvalues
a array for eigenvectors
Returns:
0 for success, i < 0, ith argument to dsyev call illegal, i > 0 for fail to converge

void GlyphViewer::sixVectorToSymMatrix ( double  eigTensors[36]  ) 

Converts eigentensors coming out of the solver into a form usable by current methods Assumption: each eig eigenTensor is [ xx yy zz xy yz xz] and the 9 is [xx xy xz yx yy yz zx zy zz ]. So the indeces are hardcoded

bool GlyphViewer::isSpherical (  ) 

get yield surface normal & plastic flow normal for this integration point go through f_real_eigens, count similar eigenvalues within 0.5 if 5 the same, it's spherical

Returns:
true for spherical

void GlyphViewer::eigenMode (  ) 

Eigentensors are not unique - they can be multiplied by any constant (including -1) and still fulfill E.x = lambda.x Test whether the first eigentensor or its negative produces greater strain

Parameters:
Tensor curr is current stiffness

double GlyphViewer::orient3D ( double  a[3],
double  b[3],
double  c[3],
double  d[3] 
)

Returns:
positive value if query point, d, lies "below" oriented plane passing through a,b,c, where a,b,c appear in counterclockwise order when viewed from "above"
Source: Jonathan Richard Shewchuk, Adaptive Precision Floating-Point Arithmetic and Fast Robust Geometric Predicates, Discrete & Computational Geometry 18:305-363, 1997

void GlyphViewer::lodeAngle ( Matrix  stress,
double &  radius,
double &  theta 
)

a way to classify deviatoric stress. r is like magnitude, theta is between triaxial extension, shear, and triaxial compression Source: Notes on Quantifying modes of a second order tensor By Rebecca Brannon
